resources.string: 1. How often you have been here
3. How loud it is around you
Point with your head/nose to the direction displayed on the screen. Touch the screen to begin - touch again to give your head orientation as the response.
Point with your head and touch the screen ...
Next time, the NaviEar stays on. Give your response as before.
Point with your head/nose towards the direction indicated by the probe sound. Touch the screen to start - touch again to give your head orientation as the response.
Next time, the NaviEar signal will stay on. You can use it to find the right response.
Now, point with your head, then touch the screen.
Now, listen to NaviEar, point with your head, then touch the screen.
Press the button indicated by the probe sound. Touch the screen to start.
Next time, the NaviEar will switch on after the probe was played - you can use it to identify the probe orientation.
Select the direction indicated by this tone.
Listen to the tone and press the respective button.
Select the direction indicated by this tone.
Next time, there will be a short break before you can give your response.
Select the direction indicated by the tone.
Walk up to the next intersection and draw a North-oriented map of the crossing roads. Click the -START drawing a map- button below when you are facing the intersection that you will draw.
Reverse the graduations on the ring so that it shows the actual heading
Increase the level of details for improved graphics
Display the compass without the status bar
You were off by __Â° to the __!
Congrats!! You have completed your training session.
Feel free to start another one. Touching the screen will bring you back to the home screen.
Angle-size estimation task: move left/right to indicate the direction of the distance.
Listen to the tones and tell the difference
You will hear two tones in quick succession - listen to them and indicate how far left/right the second sound is with respect to the first.
Press button to go to next trial
